oai_dc:dc.dc:title: On interpolation with units in H∞
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: PATRE, BM
AGASHE, SD
JAYAKUMAR, S
BANDYOPADHYAY, B
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: compensation
feedback
interpolation
stability
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The problem of finding a unit in H∞ i.e., an H ∞ function the inverse of which is also H∞ , which interpolates to given points in the right-half plane has important applications in a number of feedback stabilization problems, i.e., strong stabilization (stabilization by a stable compensator) and simultaneous stabilization (finding a common fixed compensator which stabilizes a finite set of possible plants). The present paper gives an overview of the interpolation theory and some remarks observed with different mappings used in literature to find a unit in H∞ . A new algorithm is also presented to construct a unit in H∞.
